name: Master Ball
effect: In battle: Captures one Pokémon without fail.  Has a capture rate of 255.

name: Ultra Ball
effect: In battle: Attempts to capture one Pokémon.  Has a capture rate of 2.

name: Great Ball
effect: In battle: Attempts to capture one Pokémon.  Has a capture rate of 1.5.

name: Poké Ball
effect: In battle: Attempts to capture one Pokémon.  Has a capture rate of 1.

name: Safari Ball
effect: In a Great Marsh encounter: Attempts to capture one Pokémon.  Has a capture rate of 1.5.

name: Net Ball
effect: In battle: Attempts to capture one Pokémon.  Has a capture rate of 3 against Water or Bug Pokémon, but 1 against any others.

name: Dive Ball
effect: In battle: Attempts to capture one Pokémon.  Has a capture rate of 3.5 if the trainer is underwater, but 1 otherwise.

name: Nest Ball
effect: In battle: Attempts to capture one Pokémon.  Has a capture rate of 3 if the Pokémon is level 19 or below, 2 if the Pokémon is levels 20 through 29, and 1 otherwise.

name: Repeat Ball
effect: In battle: Attempts to capture one Pokémon.  Has a capture rate of 3 against Pokémon marked as caught in the trainer's Pokédex, but 1 otherwise.

name: Timer Ball
effect: In battle: Attempts to capture one Pokémon.  Has a capture rate of 1, but increases by 1 after every tenth turn, to a maximum of 4.

name: Luxury Ball
effect: In battle: Attempts to capture one Pokémon.  Has a capture rate of 1.  Increases the rate at which the contained Pokémon gains Happiness.

name: Premier Ball
effect: In battle: Attempts to capture one Pokémon.  Has a capture rate of 1.

name: Dusk Ball
effect: In battle: Attempts to capture one Pokémon.  Has a capture rate of 4 in caves or at night, but 1 otherwise.

name: Heal Ball
effect: In battle: Attempts to capture one Pokémon.  Has a capture rate of 1.  Captured Pokémon have their HP fully restored and any major status ailments cured.

name: Quick Ball
effect: In battle: Attempts to capture one Pokémon.  Has a capture rate of 4, but decreases by 1 after every fifth turn, to a minimum of 1.

name: Cherish Ball
effect: In battle: Attempts to capture one Pokémon.  Has a capture rate of 1.

name: Potion
effect: Heals one Pokémon for 20 HP.

name: Antidote
effect: Cures one Pokémon of Poison.

name: Burn Heal
effect: Cures one Pokémon of a Burn.

name: Ice Heal
effect: Thaws one Pokémon.

name: Awakening
effect: Awakens one Pokémon.

name: Parlyz Heal
effect: Cures one Pokémon of Paralysis.

name: Full Restore
effect: Fully heals one Pokémon and cures it of any major status ailment.

name: Max Potion
effect: Fully heals one Pokémon.

name: Hyper Potion
effect: Heals one Pokémon for 200 HP.

name: Super Potion
effect: Heals one Pokémon for 50 HP.

name: Full Heal
effect: Cures one Pokémon of any major status ailment.

name: Revive

name: Max Revive
effect: Revives a Fainted Pokémon and fully restores its HP.

name: Fresh Water
effect: Heals one Pokémon for 50 HP.

name: Soda Pop
effect: Heals one Pokémon for 60 HP.

name: Lemonade
effect: Heals one Pokémon for 80 HP.

effect: Heals one Pokémon for 50 HP.  Lowers that Pokémon's Happiness by 5/5/10.

effect: Heals one Pokémon for 200 HP.  Lowers that Pokémon's Happiness by 10/10/15.

name: Heal Powder
effect: Cures one Pokémon of any major status ailment.  Lowers that Pokémon's Happiness by 5/5/10.

name: Revival Herb
effect: Revives a Fainted Pokémon and fully restores its HP.  Lowers that Pokémon's Happiness by 10/10/15.

effect: Fully restores the PP for one Pokémon's selected move.

effect: Fully restores the PP for each of one Pokémon's moves.

name: Lava Cookie
effect: Cures one Pokémon of any major status ailment.

name: Berry Juice
effect: Heals one Pokémon for 20 HP.

name: Sacred Ash
effect: Revives all Fainted Pokémon in the trainer's party and fully restores their HP.

name: HP Up
effect: Increases one Pokémon's HP effort by 10, to a maximum of 100.  Raises that Pokémon's Happiness by 5/3/2.

name: Protein
effect: Increases one Pokémon's Attack effort by 10, to a maximum of 100.  Raises that Pokémon's Happiness by 5/3/2.

name: Iron
effect: Increases one Pokémon's Defense effort by 10, to a maximum of 100.  Raises that Pokémon's Happiness by 5/3/2.

effect: Increases one Pokémon's Speed effort by 10, to a maximum of 100.  Raises that Pokémon's Happiness by 5/3/2.

name: Calcium
effect: Increases one Pokémon's Special Attack effort by 10, to a maximum of 100.  Raises that Pokémon's Happiness by 5/3/2.

name: Rare Candy
effect: Levels up one Pokémon.  Raises that Pokémon's Happiness by 5/3/2.

name: PP Up
effect: Increases the max PP for one of one Pokémon's moves by 20% its original PP, up to three times.  Raises that Pokémon's Happiness by 5/3/2.

name: Zinc
effect: Increases one Pokémon's Special Defense effort by 10, to a maximum of 100.  Raises that Pokémon's Happiness by 5/3/2.

name: PP Max
effect: Increases the max PP for one of one Pokémon's moves to its original PP plus 60%.  Raises that Pokémon's Happiness by 5/3/2.

name: Old Gateau
effect: Cures one Pokémon of any major status ailment.

name: Guard Spec.
effect: In battle: Prevents one Pokémon's stats from being lowered for the next five turns.  Raises that Pokémon's Happiness by 1/1/0.

name: Dire Hit
effect: In battle: Raises one Pokémon's critical hit counter by 1.  Raises that Pokémon's Happiness by 1/1/0.

name: X Attack
effect: In battle: Raises one Pokémon's Attack.  Raises that Pokémon's Happiness by 1/1/0.

name: X Defend

effect: In battle: Raises one Pokémon's Special Attack.  Raises that Pokémon's Happiness by 1/1/0.

name: X Sp. Def
effect: In battle: Raises one Pokémon's Special Defense.  Raises that Pokémon's Happiness by 1/1/0.

name: Poké Doll
effect: In wild battles: Ends the battle.

name: Fluffy Tail
effect: In wild battles: Ends the battle.

effect: Trade 10 for a Sunny Day TM in the house midway along the southern section of Route 212.

effect: Prevents wild battles with Pokémon that are lower level than the trainer's lead Pokémon for 250 steps.

name: Escape Rope
effect: Transports the trainer to the entrance of the cave s/he is in.  Only usable in caves.

name: Repel
effect: Prevents wild battles with Pokémon that are lower level than the trainer's lead Pokémon for 100 steps.

name: Sun Stone
effect: Evolves a Gloom into Bellossom or a Sunkern into Sunflora.

name: Moon Stone
effect: Evolves a Clefairy into Clefable, Jigglypuff into Wigglytuff, Nidorina into Nidoqueen, Nidorino into Nidoking, or Skitty into Delcatty.

name: Fire Stone
effect: Evolves an Eevee into Flareon, a Growlithe into Arcanine, or a Vulpix into Ninetales.

effect: Held: When the holder is hit by a physical attack and survives, this Berry is consumed, and the opposing Pokémon takes 1/8 its max HP in damage.

name: BrightPowder
effect: Held: Raises the holder's Evasion 10% (added, not multiplied).

name: White Herb
effect: Held: After each move, if any of the holder's stats are below normal, this item is consumed and restores them to normal.

name: Macho Brace
effect: Held: Doubles the effort the holder earns.  Halves the holder's Speed.

name: Exp. Share
effect: Held: The holder counts as having participated in the battle when Exp is distributed, whether or not it actually did.

name: Quick Claw
effect: Held: The holder has a 3/16 chance to move first within its move's priority bracket, regardless of Speed.

name: Soothe Bell
effect: Held: Doubles any Happiness earned by the holder.

name: Mental Herb
effect: Held: When the holder becomes Attracted, this Berry is consumed and cures the Attraction.

name: Choice Band
effect:
Held: Increases the holder's Attack by 50%, but restricts it to the first move it uses until it leaves battle or loses this item.  If this item is swapped for another Choice item via Trick or Switcheroo, the holder's restriction is still lifted, but it will again be restricted to the next move it uses.
(Quirk: If the holder is switched in by U-Turn and it also knows U-Turn, U-Turn becomes its restricted move.)

name: King's Rock
effect:
Held: When the holder attacks with most damaging moves, provides an extra 11.7% (30/256) chance for the target to flinch.
Held by Poliwhirl or Slowbro: Evolves the holder into Politoed or Slowking when traded, respectively.

name: SilverPowder
effect: Held: Increases the power of the holder's Bug moves by 20%.

name: Amulet Coin
effect: Held: Doubles the money the trainer receives after an in-game trainer battle.  This effect cannot apply more than once to the same battle.

name: Cleanse Tag
effect: Held by lead Pokémon: Prevents wild battles with Pokémon that are lower level than the holder.

name: Soul Dew
effect: Held by Latias or Latios: Increases the holder's Special Attack and Special Defense by 50%.

name: Smoke Ball
effect: Held: In wild battles, attempts to run away on the holder's turn will always succeed.

name: Everstone
effect: Held: Prevents the holder from evolving naturally.  Evolution initiated by the trainer (Stones, etc) will still work.

effect: Held: Increases any Exp the holder gains by 50%.

effect: Held: The holder's Reflect and Light Screen will create effects lasting for eight turns rather than five.  As this item affects the move rather than the barrier itself, the effect is not lost if the holder leaves battle or drops this item.

effect: Held by Ditto: Doubles the holder's initial Speed.

name: Focus Sash
effect: Held: If the holder has full HP and is attacked for regular damage that would faint it, this item is consumed and prevents the holder's HP from lowering below 1.  This effect works against multi-hit attacks, but does not work against the effects of Doom Desire or Future Sight.

name: Zoom Lens
effect:
Held: Raises the holder's Accuracy by 20% when it goes last.
Ingame description is incorrect.

name: Metronome
effect: Held: Each time the holder uses the same move consecutively, its power is increased by another 10% of its original, to a maximum of 100%.

name: Iron Ball
effect: Held: Decreases the holder's Speed by 50%.  If the holder is Flying or has Levitate, it takes regular damage from Ground attacks and is suspectible to Spikes and Toxic Spikes.

name: Lagging Tail
effect: Held: The holder will go last within its move's priority bracket, regardless of Speed.  If multiple Pokémon within the same priority bracket are subject to this effect, the slower Pokémon will go first.  The holder will move after Pokémon with Stall.  If the holder has Stall, Stall is ignored.  This item ignores Trick Room.

name: Destiny Knot
effect: Held: When the holder becomes Attracted, the Pokémon it is Attracted to becomes Attracted back.

name: Black Sludge
effect: Held: If the holder is Poison-type, restores 1/16 max HP at the end of each turn.  Otherwise, damages the holder by 1/16 its max HP at the end of each turn.

name: Icy Rock
effect: Held: The holder's Hail will create a hailstorm lasting for eight turns rather than five.  As this item affects the move rather than the weather itself, the effect is not lost if the holder leaves battle or drops this item.

name: Smooth Rock
effect: Held: The holder's Sandstorm will create a sandstorm lasting for eight turns rather than five.  As this item affects the move rather than the weather itself, the effect is not lost if the holder leaves battle or drops this item.

name: Heat Rock
effect: Held: The holder's Sunny Day will create sunshine lasting for eight turns rather than five.  As this item affects the move rather than the weather itself, the effect is not lost if the holder leaves battle or drops this item.

name: Damp Rock
effect: Held: The holder's Rain Dance will create rain lasting for eight turns rather than five.  As this item affects the move rather than the weather itself, the effect is not lost if the holder leaves battle or drops this item.

name: Grip Claw
effect: Held: Increases the duration of the holder's multiturn (2-5 turn) moves by three turns.

name: Choice Scarf
effect:
Held: Increases the holder's Speed by 50%, but restricts it to the first move it uses until it leaves battle or loses this item.  If this item is swapped for another Choice item via Trick or Switcheroo, the holder's restriction is still lifted, but it will again be restricted to the next move it uses.
(Quirk: If the holder is switched in by U-Turn and it also knows U-Turn, U-Turn becomes its restricted move.)

name: Sticky Barb
effect: Held: Damaged the holder for 1/8 its max HP.  When the holder is struck by a contact move, damages the attacker for 1/8 its max HP; if the attacker is not holding an item, it will take this item.

name: Power Bracer
effect: Held: Decreases the holder's Speed by 50%.  Whenever the holder gains Attack effort from battle, increases that effort by 4; this applies before the PokéRUS doubling effect.

name: Power Belt
effect: Held: Decreases the holder's Speed by 50%.  Whenever the holder gains Defense effort from battle, increases that effort by 4; this applies before the PokéRUS doubling effect.

name: Power Lens
effect: Held: Decreases the holder's Speed by 50%.  Whenever the holder gains Special Attack effort from battle, increases that effort by 4; this applies before the PokéRUS doubling effect.

name: Power Band
effect: Held: Decreases the holder's Speed by 50%.  Whenever the holder gains Special Defense effort from battle, increases that effort by 4; this applies before the PokéRUS doubling effect.

name: Power Anklet
effect: Held: Decreases the holder's Speed by 50%.  Whenever the holder gains Speed effort from battle, increases that effort by 4; this applies before the PokéRUS doubling effect.

name: Power Weight
effect: Held: Decreases the holder's Speed by 50%.  Whenever the holder gains HP effort from battle, increases that effort by 4; this applies before the PokéRUS doubling effect.

name: Shed Shell
effect: Held: The holder is unaffected by any moves or abilities that would prevent it from actively leaving battle.

name: Big Root
effect: Held: HP restored from Absorb, Aqua Ring, Drain Punch, Dream Eater, Giga Drain, Ingrain, Leech Life, Leech Seed, and Mega Drain is increased by 30%.  Damage inflicted is not affected.

name: Choice Specs
effect:
Held: Increases the holder's Special Attack by 50%, but restricts it to the first move it uses until it leaves battle or loses this item.  If this item is swapped for another Choice item via Trick or Switcheroo, the holder's restriction is still lifted, but it will again be restricted to the next move it uses.
(Quirk: If the holder is switched in by U-Turn and it also knows U-Turn, U-Turn becomes its restricted move.)

name: Flame Plate
effect:
Held: Increases the power of the holder's Fire moves by 20%.
Held by a Multitype Pokémon: Holder's type becomes Fire.

name: Splash Plate
effect:
Held: Increases the power of the holder's Water moves by 20%.
Held by a Multitype Pokémon: Holder's type becomes Water.

name: Zap Plate
effect:
Held: Increases the power of the holder's Electric moves by 20%.
Held by a Multitype Pokémon: Holder's type becomes Electric.

name: Meadow Plate
effect:
Held: Increases the power of the holder's Grass moves by 20%.
Held by a Multitype Pokémon: Holder's type becomes Grass.

Held: Increases the power of the holder's Ice moves by 20%.
Held by a Multitype Pokémon: Holder's type becomes Ice.

Held: Increases the power of the holder's Fighting moves by 20%.
Held by a Multitype Pokémon: Holder's type becomes Fighting.

name: Toxic Plate
effect:
Held: Increases the power of the holder's Poison moves by 20%.
Held by a Multitype Pokémon: Holder's type becomes Poison.

Held: Increases the power of the holder's Ground moves by 20%.
Held by a Multitype Pokémon: Holder's type becomes Ground.

name: Sky Plate
effect:
Held: Increases the power of the holder's Flying moves by 20%.
Held by a Multitype Pokémon: Holder's type becomes Flying.

effect:
Held: Increases the power of the holder's Psychic moves by 20%.
Held by a Multitype Pokémon: Holder's type becomes Psychic.

name: Insect Plate
effect:
Held: Increases the power of the holder's Bug moves by 20%.
Held by a Multitype Pokémon: Holder's type becomes Bug.

name: Stone Plate
effect:
Held: Increases the power of the holder's Rock moves by 20%.
Held by a Multitype Pokémon: Holder's type becomes Rock.

name: Spooky Plate
effect:
Held: Increases the power of the holder's Ghost moves by 20%.
Held by a Multitype Pokémon: Holder's type becomes Ghost.

name: Draco Plate
effect:
Held: Increases the power of the holder's Dragon moves by 20%.
Held by a Multitype Pokémon: Holder's type becomes Dragon.

name: Dread Plate
effect:
Held: Increases the power of the holder's Dark moves by 20%.
Held by a Multitype Pokémon: Holder's type becomes Dark.

name: Iron Plate
effect:
Held: Increases the power of the holder's Steel moves by 20%.
Held by a Multitype Pokémon: Holder's type becomes Steel.

name: Odd Incense
effect: Held: Increases the power of the holder's Psychic moves by 20%.

name: Rock Incense
effect: Held: Increases the power of the holder's Rock moves by 20%.

name: Full Incense
effect: Held: The holder will go last within its move's priority bracket, regardless of Speed.  If multiple Pokémon within the same priority bracket are subject to this effect, the slower Pokémon will go first.  The holder will move after Pokémon with Stall.  If the holder has Stall, Stall is ignored.  This item ignores Trick Room.

name: Wave Incense
effect: Held: Increases the power of the holder's Water moves by 20%.

name: Rose Incense
effect: Held: Increases the power of the holder's Grass moves by 20%.

name: Luck Incense
effect: Held: Doubles the money the trainer receives after an in-game trainer battle.  This effect cannot apply more than once to the same battle.

name: Pure Incense
effect: Held by lead Pokémon: Prevents wild battles with Pokémon that are lower level than the holder.

name: Protector
effect: Held by Rhydon: Evolves the holder into Rhyperior when traded.

name: Electirizer
effect: Held by Electabuzz: Evolves the holder into Electivire when traded.

name: Magmarizer
effect: Held by Magmar: Evolves the holder into Magmortar when traded.

name: Dubious Disc
effect: Held by Porygon2: Evolves the holder into Porygon-Z when traded.

name: Reaper Cloth
effect: Held by Dusclops: Evolves the holder into Dusknoir when traded.

name: Razor Claw
effect:
Held: Raises the holder's critical hit counter by 1.
Held by Sneasel: Evolves the holder into Weavile when it levels up during the night.

name: Razor Fang
effect:
Held: When the holder attacks with most damaging moves, provides an extra 11.7% (30/256) chance for the target to flinch.
Held by Gligar: Evolves the holder into Gliscor when traded.

name: Explorer Kit
effect: Sends the trainer to the Underground.  Only usable outside.

name: Loot Sack
effect: Unused.

name: Rule Book
effect: Unused.

name: Poké Radar
effect: Designates several nearby patches of grass as containing Pokémon, some of which may be special radar-only Pokémon.  Successive uses in a certain way create chains of encounters with the same species; longer chains increase the chance that a shiny Pokémon of that species will appear.

name: Point Card
effect: Tracks Battle Points.

name: Journal
effect: Records some of the trainer's activities for the day.

name: Seal Case
effect: Contains Seals used for decorating Pokéballs.

name: Fashion Case
effect: Contains Pokémon Accessories.

name: Seal Bag
effect: Unused.

name: Pal Pad
effect: Contains friend codes for up to 32 other players, as well as their sprite, gender, and basic statistics for those that have been seen on WFC.

name: Works Key
effect: Opens the front door of the Valley Windworks.  Reusable.

name: Old Charm
effect: Given to Cynthia's grandmother to get the Surf HM.

name: Galactic Key
effect: Grants access to Galactic HQ in Veilstone City.

name: Red Chain
effect: Unused.

name: Town Map
effect: Displays a map of the region including the trainer's position, location names, visited towns, gym locations, and where the trainer has been walking recently.

name: Vs. Seeker
effect: Reveals trainers who want a rematch, by showing !! over their heads.  Each use drains the battery; requires 100 steps to charge.

name: Coin Case
effect: Contains the Coins used by the Game Corner, to a maximum of 50,000.

name: Old Rod
effect: Used to find Pokémon on the Old Rod list for an area, which are generally Magikarp or similar.

name: Good Rod
effect: Used to find Pokémon on the Good Rod list for an area, which are generally mediocre.

name: Super Rod
effect: Used to find Pokémon on the Super Rod list for an area, which are generally the best available there.

name: Sprayduck
effect: Waters Berry plants.

name: Poffin Case
effect: Contains up to 100 Poffins.

name: Bicycle
effect: Increases movement speed outside or in caves.  In high gear, allows the trainer to hop over some rocks and ascend muddy slopes.

name: Suite Key
effect: Opens the locked building in the lakeside resort.

name: Oak's Letter
effect: Grants access to Flower Paradise and Shaymin.

name: Lunar Wing
effect: Cures the sailor's son of his nightmares; no reward, only a side effect of seeing Cresselia.

name: Member Card
effect: Provides access to Newmoon Island and Darkrai.

name: Azure Flute
effect: Supposedly related to t

name: S.S. Ticket
effect: Unused.

name: Contest Pass
effect: Allows the trainer to enter Contests.

name: Magma Stone
effect: Unused.

name: Parcel
effect: Given to the trainer's rival in Jubilife City.  Contains two Town Maps, one of which is given to the trainer upon delivery.

name: Coupon 1
effect: One of three coupons needed to receive a Pokétch.

name: Coupon 2
effect: One of three coupons needed to receive a Pokétch.

name: Coupon 3
effect: One of three coupons needed to receive a Pokétch.

name: Storage Key
effect: Grants access to the Team Galactic warehouse in Veilstone City.

name: SecretPotion
effect: Required to cure the Psyducks blocking Route 210 of their chronic headaches.

name: Griseous Orb
effect:
Held by :pokemon:`Giratina`
    Holder's :type:`dragon` and :type:`ghost` moves have 1.2× their base power.

    Holder is in Origin Forme.

This item cannot be held by any Pokémon but Giratina.  When you enter the Union Room or connect to Wi-Fi, this item returns to your bag.

name: Vs. Recorder
effect:
Optionally records wireless, Wi-Fi, and Battle Frontier battles.

Tracks Battle Points earned in the Battle Frontier, and stores commemorative prints.

name: Gracidea
effect:
Used by trainer on a :pokemon:`Shaymin`
    Changes the target Shaymin from Land Forme to Sky Forme.

    This item cannot be used on a :mechanic:`frozen` Shaymin or at night.  Sky Forme Shaymin will revert to Land Forme overnight, when frozen, and upon entering a link battle.  This item must be used again to change it back.

name: Secret Key
effect:
Used by trainer in the Galactic Eterna Building, on the ground floor, to the left of the TV
    Unlocks the secret :pokemon:`Rotom` room, in which there are five appliances which can change Rotom's form.

name: Apricorn Box
effect: Stores Apricorns.

name: Berry Pots
effect: Contains four portable pots of soil suitable for growing berries.

name: Squirtbottle
effect:
Required to water berries within the :item:`Berry Pots`.

Required to battle the :pokemon:`Sudowoodo` on :location:`Route 36`.

This item cannot be directly used from the bag.

name: Lure Ball
effect:
Used by trainer in battle
    Attempts to :mechanic:`catch` a wild Pokémon.  If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

    If the wild Pokémon was encountered by fishing, the wild Pokémon's catch rate is 3× normal.

name: Level Ball
effect:
Used by trainer in battle
    Attempts to :mechanic:`catch` a wild Pokémon.  If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

    If the trainer's Pokémon's level is higher than:
    * four times the wild Pokémon's, the wild Pokémon's catch rate is 8× normal.
    * than twice the wild Pokémon's, the wild Pokémon's catch rate is 4× normal.
    * the wild Pokémon's, the wild Pokémon's catch rate is 2× normal.

name: Moon Ball
effect:
Used by trainer in battle
    Attempts to :mechanic:`catch` a wild Pokémon.  If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

    If the wild Pokémon is a :pokemon:`Clefairy`, :pokemon:`Nidoran♂`, :pokemon:`Nidoran♀`, :pokemon:`Jigglypuff`, :pokemon:`Skitty`, or any evolution thereof, the wild Pokémon has 4× its catch rate.

name: Heavy Ball
effect:
Used by a trainer in battle
    Attempts to :mechanic:`catch` a wild Pokémon.  If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

    If the wild Pokémon weighs:
    * 409.6 kg (903.0 lb) or more, its catch rate is 40 more than normal.
    * 307.2 kg (677.3 lb) or more, its catch rate is 30 more than normal.
    * 204.8 kg (451.5 lb) or more, its catch rate is 20 more than normal.
    * less than 204.8 kg (451.5 lb), its catch rate is 20 less than normal.

name: Fast Ball
effect:
Used by a trainer in battle
    Attempts to :mechanic:`catch` a wild Pokémon.  If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

    If the wild Pokémon's base :mechanic:`Speed` is 100 or more, its catch rate is 4× normal.

name: Friend Ball
effect:
Used by a trainer in battle
    Attempts to :mechanic:`catch` a wild Pokémon.  If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

    If caught, the wild Pokémon's :mechanic:`happiness` starts at 200.

name: Love Ball
effect:
Used by a trainer in battle
    Attempts to :mechanic:`catch` a wild Pokémon.  If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

    If the trainer's Pokémon and wild Pokémon are of the same species but opposite genders, the wild Pokémon's catch rate is 8× normal.

name: Park Ball
effect:
Used by a trainer in battle
    :mechanic:`Catch`\ es a wild Pokémon.

This item can only be used in :location:`Pal Park`.

name: Sport Ball
effect:
Used by a trainer in battle
    Attempts to :mechanic:`catch` a wild Pokémon.

    The wild Pokémon's catch rate is 1.5× normal.

name: Red Apricorn
effect: May be given to Kurt in :location:`Azalea Town` to produce a :item:`Level Ball`.

name: Blu Apricorn
effect: May be given to Kurt in :location:`Azalea Town` to produce a :item:`Lure Ball`.

name: Ylw Apricorn
effect: May be given to Kurt in :location:`Azalea Town` to produce a :item:`Moon Ball`.

name: Grn Apricorn
effect: May be given to Kurt in :location:`Azalea Town` to produce a :item:`Friend Ball`.

name: Pnk Apricorn
effect: May be given to Kurt in :location:`Azalea Town` to produce a :item:`Love Ball`.

name: Wht Apricorn
effect: May be given to Kurt in :location:`Azalea Town` to produce a :item:`Fast Ball`.

name: Blk Apricorn
effect: May be given to Kurt in :location:`Azalea Town` to produce a :item:`Heavy Ball`.

name: Dowsing MCHN
effect:
Used by trainer outside of battle
    Searches for hidden items.

name: RageCandyBar
effect: May be traded for a :item:`TM64` in the vertical Underground Path.

name: Red Orb
effect: Causes :pokemon:`Groudon` to appear in the :location:`Embedded Tower`.

name: Blue Orb
effect: Causes :pokemon:`Kyogre` to appear in the :location:`Embedded Tower`.

name: Jade Orb
effect: Causes :pokemon:`Rayquaza` to appear in the :location:`Embedded Tower`.

name: Enigma Stone
effect:
When taken to the :location:`Pewter City` museum, causes :pokemon:`Latias` or :pokemon:`Latios` to attack the trainer.

The Pokémon to appear will be whicher can't be encountered roaming in the wild.

name: Unown Report
effect: Lists which :pokemon:`Unown` forms the trainer has caught.

name: Blue Card
effect: Allows the trainer to answer the daily question on Buena's radio show.  Records the points earned for correct answers.

name: Slowpoketail
effect: Does nothing.

name: Clear Bell
effect: May be given to the Kimono Girls to summon :pokemon:`Ho-Oh` to the top of the :location:`Bell Tower`.

name: Card Key
effect:
Used by trainer outside of battle
    Opens doors in the :location:`Goldenrod City` Radio Tower.

name: Basement Key
effect:
Used by trainer outside of battle
    Opens the door to the basement tunnel under :location:`Goldenrod City`.

name: Red Scale
effect: May be traded to Mr. Pokémon for an :item:`Exp. Share`.

name: Lost Item
effect: May be traded to the Copycat for a :item:`Pass`.

name: Pass
effect: Allows the trainer to ride the Magnet Train between :location:`Goldenrod City` and :location:`Saffron City`.

name: Machine Part
effect: Must be replaced in the :location:`Power Plant` to power the Magnet Train.

name: Silver Wing
effect: Causes :pokemon:`Lugia` to appear in the :location:`Whirl Islands`.

name: Rainbow Wing
effect: Causes :pokemon:`Ho-Oh` to appear at the top of :location:`Bell Tower`.

name: Mystery Egg
effect: Must be obtained to trigger the break-in at Professor Elm's lab, the first rival battle, and access to :location:`Route 31`.

name: GB Sounds
effect:
Used by trainer outside of battle
    Changes the background music to the equivalent 8-bit music.

name: Tidal Bell
effect: May be given to the Kimono Girls to summon :pokemon:`Lugia` to the top of the :location:`Bell Tower`.

name: Data Card 01
effect: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first place overall in the Pokéathlon.

name: Data Card 02
effect: Records the number of times the trainer has come in last place overall in the Pokéathlon.

name: Data Card 03
effect: Records the number of times the trainer's Pokémon have dashed in the Pokéathlon.

name: Data Card 04
effect: Records the number of times the trainer's Pokémon have jumped in the Pokéathlon.

name: Data Card 05
effect: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Hurdle Dash.

name: Data Card 06
effect: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Relay Run.

name: Data Card 07
effect: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Pennant Capture.

name: Data Card 08
effect: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Block Smash.

name: Data Card 09
effect: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Disc Catch.

name: Data Card 10
effect: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Snow Throw.

name: Data Card 11
effect: Records the number of points the trainer has earned in the Pokéathlon.

name: Data Card 12
effect: Records the number of times the trainer's Pokémon have messed up in the Pokéathlon.

name: Data Card 13
effect: Records the number of times the trainer's Pokémon have defeated themselves in the Pokéathlon.

name: Data Card 14
effect: Records the number of times the trainer's Pokémon have tackled in the Pokéathlon.

name: Data Card 15
effect: Records the number of times the trainer's Pokémon have fallen in the Pokéathlon.

name: Data Card 16
effect: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Ring Drop.

name: Data Card 17
effect: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Lamp Jump.

name: Data Card 18
effect: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Circle Push.

name: Data Card 19
effect: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first place overall in the Pokéathlon over wirelss.

name: Data Card 20
effect: Records the number of times the trainer has come in last place overall in the Pokéathlon over wireless.

name: Data Card 21
effect: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first across all Pokéathlon events.

name: Data Card 22
effect: Records the number of times the trainer has come in last across all Pokéathlon events.

name: Data Card 23
effect: Records the number of times the trainer has switched Pokémon in the Pokéathlon.

name: Data Card 24
effect: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Goal Roll.

name: Data Card 25
effect: Records the number of times the trainer's Pokémon received prizes in the Pokéathlon.

name: Data Card 26
effect: Records the number of times the trainer has instructed Pokémon in the Pokéathlon.

name: Data Card 27
effect: Records the total time spent in the Pokéathlon.

name: Lock Capsule
effect: Does nothing.

name: Photo Album
effect: Does nothing.

name: Mach Bike
effect: Increases movement speed outside or in caves.  Faster than the :item:`Acro Bike`.  Allows the trainer to ascend muddy slopes.

name: Acro Bike
effect: Increases movement speed outside or in caves.  Slower than the :item:`Mach Bike`.  Can perform various tricks, allowing the trainer to reach certain special areas.

name: Wailmer Pail
effect: Waters Berry plants.

name: Devon Goods
effect: Contains a machine part to be delivered to Captain Stern.

name: Soot Sack
effect: Collects soot when walking through tall grass on :location:`Route 113`.

name: Pokéblock Case
effect: Stores Pokéblocks.

name: Letter
effect: Contains a letter to be delivered to Steven.

name: Eon Ticket
effect: Provides access to :location:`Southern Island` and either :pokemon:`Latias` or :pokemon:`Latios`, whichever is not available roaming around Hoenn.

name: Scanner
effect: May be traded to Captain Stern for a :item:`DeepSeaTooth` or a :item:`DeepSeaScale`.

name: Go-Goggles
effect: Allows the trainer to enter the desert on :location:`Route 111`.

name: Meteorite
effect:
RSE: May be traded to Professor Cozmo for :item:`TM27`.

FRLG: A meteorite to be delivered to Lostelle's father.

name: Rm. 1 Key
effect: Unlocks room 1 on the :location:`Abandoned Ship`.

name: Rm. 2 Key
effect: Unlocks room 2 on the :location:`Abandoned Ship`.

name: Rm. 4 Key
effect: Unlocks room 4 on the :location:`Abandoned Ship`.

name: Rm. 6 Key
effect: Unlocks room 6 on the :location:`Abandoned Ship`.

name: Devon Scope
effect: Reveals invisble :pokemon:`Kecleon` on the overworld.

name: Oak's Parcel
effect: A parcel to be delivered to Professor Oak for a Pokédex.

name: Poké Flute
effect: Wakes up :mechanic:`sleeping` Pokémon.  Required to wake up sleeping :pokemon:`Snorlax` on the overworld.

name: Bike Voucher
effect: May be traded for a :item:`Bicycle`.

name: Gold Teeth
effect: The Safari Zone warden's teeth, to be returned to him for :item:`HM04`.

name: Lift Key
effect: Operates the elevator in the Celadon Rocket Hideout.

name: Silph Scope
effect: Identifies ghosts in :location:`Pokémon Tower`.

name: Fame Checker
effect: Records information on various famous people.

name: TM Case
effect: Stores TMs and HMs.

name: Berry Pouch
effect: Stores Berries.

name: Teachy TV
effect: Teaches beginning trainers basic information.

name: Tri-Pass
effect: Provides access to the first three Sevii Islands.

name: Rainbow Pass
effect: Provides access to the Sevii Islands.

name: Tea
effect: Used to bribe the :location:`Saffron City` guards for entry to the city.

name: MysticTicket
effect: Provides access to :location:`Navel Rock`, :pokemon:`Ho-Oh`, and :pokemon:`Lugia`.

name: AuroraTicket
effect: Provides access to :location:`Birth Island` and :pokemon:`Deoxys`.

name: Powder Jar
effect: Holds Berry Powder from Berry Crushing.

name: Ruby
effect: Deliver to Celio for use in the Network Machine.

name: Sapphire
effect: Deliver to Celio for use in the Network Machine.

name: Magma Emblem
effect: Provides access to the :location:`Team Magma Hideout` in the :location:`Jagged Pass`.

name: Old Sea Map
effect: Provides access to :location:`Faraway Island` and :pokemon:`Mew`.
